K, X = map(int, input().split())

The code reads two integers K and X from the input, calculates the total value of K 500-yen coins, and then checks if this total is greater than or equal to X. If it is, it prints "Yes", otherwise it prints "No".

K, X = map(int, input().split())
print("Yes" if K * 500 >= X else "No")


This program reads two integers K and X from the standard input. It then checks if K * 500 is greater than or equal to X. If it is, it prints "Yes"; otherwise, it prints "No".

This is a simple Python program that uses an if-else statement to solve the problem. It uses the ternary operator (`expr1 if condition else expr2`) to simplify the code. The condition is `K * 500 >= X`, which is True if K * 500 is greater than or equal to X, and False otherwise. If the condition is True, the program prints "Yes"; otherwise, it prints "No".

If these coins add up to X yen or more, print Yes; otherwise, print No.

Input is given from Standard Input in the following format:
K X

-----Output-----
If the coins add up to X yen or more, print Yes; otherwise, print No.

-----Sample Input-----
2 900

-----Sample Output-----
Yes
